subject: Looking for advice on testing scenario

Hi,

I am new to JUNIT and although I've read all of the docs (save the
jav=
adoc) it's not entirely clear to me how to proceed or even if JUNIT
is appr=
opriate for my needs.  I will explain the situation and was
hoping that may=
be someone could point me in the right direction.

I have written a SQL par=
ser which parses a SQL query and builds an
object model representation of s=
ame which it returns as the result of
a parse.  The object model has the ab=
ility to print itself and so long
as the parser works correctly what it pri=
nts will be very close to the
input query.  A single test case then consist=
s of parsing a query,
calling printMe( ) on the resultant tree and comparin=
g it's output to
what was expected, which again, is very similar to but not=
 identical
to the original query.

So, first a general question: I know tha=
t his is closer to end to end
testing than it is to the sort of fine graine=
d class level tests JUNIT
is designed for.  Is JUNIT even appropriate?  Ass=
uming the answer is
yes, I'll continue.

The pseudo code for a single test =
case would look like this:

String orgnlQry =3D "Select * from MyTable.MyCo=
lumn";
String expectedQry =3D "Select * from MyColumn";
Parser myParser =3D=
 new Parser( );
// A bunch of code to construct Parser and connect to data =
store
myParser.parse(orgnlQry);
SQLTree tree =3D myParser.getTree( );
Strin=
g outQry =3D tree.printMe( );
assertEquals(outQry, expectedQry);

I'd like =
all of my test cases to use the same parser instance so that
I only have to=
 initialize it once.  The only variables for each test
than are the orgnl/e=
xpectedQry pairs of which I've got about 120.  

I'm able to get a single t=
est case running but I can't figure out how
to eliminate duplicate code.  I=
'm also no sure how to organize the
tests.  Shold there really be 120 diffe=
rent test methods or is there
some way to call the same test method 120 tim=
es with different input
strings?  

Thanks in advance for any suggestions a=
nyone can provide.

-ts1971
